function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Propagation of contagious diseases through data sharing and integration","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of interoperability between ontologies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to align terms under basic formal ontology bfo","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate representation of coronavirus infectious diseases in cido","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Interoperability with over 300 other ontologies increases the risk of propagating inaccuracies and inconsistencies in disease data.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of cido-specific terms for covid-19 and other coronavirus diseases may lead to discrepancies in terminology and classification with existing ontologies.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Logical axioms and relations within the ontology may introduce errors or biases in representing disease processes and causation.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Identification of drugs with potential anti-coronavirus effects","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unregulated promotion of drugs based on information extracted from ontologies","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of drug information in existing ontologies","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of misinformation due to incomplete ontology-based approaches","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to community-based metadata standardization for clinical and experimental studies.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Historical pandemics recurring every 30 to 40 years","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of pandemics on the design of buildings and cities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fast and unstoppable disease transmission due to high human mobility","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overload of hospitals and quarantine facilities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changing living styles and uncertain conditions leading to the need for infectious disease-friendly building designs","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Historically, pandemics have always had an impact on architecture.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Human fear of infectious diseases has led to the emergence of artificial environments.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited technology, knowledge, and resources make historical solutions to pandemics not applicable worldwide.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of good sunlight and air flow in building design","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate cleanliness and surface contamination","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient home designs for covid-19 treatment and prevention","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation and air circulation in homes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate isolation facilities in homes","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of isolation room for infected individuals","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adaptability and flexibility in house design","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Choice of interior design facilitating the spread of the virus and virus retention on surfaces.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and indoor air quality leading to increased risk of disease infection.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exterior and outdoor spaces becoming essential due to the pandemic, leading to potential overcrowding and virus transmission.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased outdoor activities can lead to closer human interactions and spread of contagious diseases","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglecting the value of the house may lead to poor living conditions and lack of hygiene, contributing to the spread of diseases","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of local products and minimal energy consumption in housing may lead to compromised indoor air quality and ventilation, creating a conducive environment for disease transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Viruses spreading in built environments","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Permanent changes in architectural design and lifestyle","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in indoor spaces leading to the spread of covid-19","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to social distancing and mask-wearing guidelines","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor hygiene and sanitization practices in shared environments","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of sar-cov-2 in public spaces due to relaxation of restrictions","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long-term transformation of social interactions in public spaces","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Future uncertainty and fear regarding public space use","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the impact of covid-19 on public space","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift in acceptable and radical policies","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global pandemic causing long-term impacts on planning and design of public spaces.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Refinement of practices in response to the pandemic, leaving fundamental approaches and values unchanged.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The need to integrate new ideas about public health into practice and leverage the crisis to build more just, healthier, and greener cities.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 may change public space design and use, affecting how people interact and move within public spaces.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate queuing space outside shops and public facilities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for drop off and delivery space due to online shopping and home food delivery","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Controversial nature of street redesigns and political challenges","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
